keyword: calories in half a cup of blueberries
title: Calories in Half a Cup of Blueberries
meta_description: Discover calories in half a cup of blueberries—about 42 kcal—plus carbs, fiber, protein, fat, and per-cup nutrition basis for easy tracking.
h1: Calories in Half a Cup of Blueberries
assumptions: Fresh, whole blueberries; 1 cup ≈148 g, so half cup ≈74 g; raw, no added sugar.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by variety, ripeness, freshness, and measurement; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Half a cup of fresh blueberries provides ~42 kcal and ~10.7 g carbs, mostly from natural sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp sugar per half cup

faqs.q: How many calories in half a cup of blueberries?
What are the carbs in half a cup of blueberries?
faqs.a: Approximately 10.7 g carbs, including 1.8 g fiber and 7.4 g sugars.

faqs.q: Are blueberries low in fat and protein?
faqs.a: Yes—0.2 g fat and 0.6 g protein per half cup.

faqs.q: How does frozen affect calories in blueberries?
faqs.a: Frozen unsweetened blueberries have similar calories to fresh, around 42 kcal per half cup.

faqs.q: What's the fiber content in half a cup of blueberries?
faqs.a: About 1.8 g dietary fiber, aiding digestion.
